title: The Truth About Focus
content:
The Truth About Focus
[专注的真相]
Today I continued summarizing Li Xiaolai’s book — The Truth About Focus.
[今天继续来复述李笑来的书——《专注的真相》]
First, let’s talk about a commonly heard term: dopamine. It’s often associated with feelings of pleasure and satisfaction.
[首先要介绍的是经常听说的一个名词多巴胺，以前总将多巴胺与快乐、满足这样的感受放在一起。]
But dopamine itself isn’t the substance of pleasure—it’s a chemical that makes you want something and crave doing it again.
[但是多巴胺不是快乐的物质本身，而是产生让你想要、渴望再去做这件事的一种化学物质。]
Take scrolling on TikTok as an example. The constant swiping triggers dopamine release, which creates the urge to keep going.
[举刷抖音这个例子，当你不断往下滑动刷新视频时候，多巴胺的分泌就会让你产生继续的冲动。]
Of course, this can be seen as a negative example—but dopamine can also be harnessed for “good” things like studying, reading, or completing plans.
[当然可以讲这个例子视为消极的例子，因为多巴胺可以将其利用在“好”的地方，比如学习、阅读、有计划地完成一些计划。]
Besides short videos, things like gambling, gaming, social media, and drugs can all easily disrupt your dopamine system.
[除了刚才说的短视频外、赌博、游戏、社交媒体、毒品等都很容易影响多巴胺系统。]
That’s why we need to protect our dopamine system and avoid its overuse or damage.
[所以平时需要注意保护，防止多巴胺系统被滥用或破坏。]
Dopamine is a lot like desire. Managing dopamine is like managing desire—if you constantly remind yourself that you’re a long-term thinker, you can control your impulses and use dopamine wisely.
[多巴胺与欲望特别像，使用多巴胺就像控制欲望，只要时刻提醒自己是个长期主义者就能很好地控制欲望、正确地使用多巴胺了。]
Speaking of desire, the book introduces two concepts: the “desire loop” and the “control loop.”
[说到欲望，这里有个欲望回路与控制回路的概念。]
The desire loop—also called the impulse loop—generates cravings, motivations, and the drive for instant rewards. For example, scrolling short videos activates this loop.
[在大脑中欲望回路也就是冲动回路，主要作用是产生欲望、动机、即时奖励驱动，比如刚才说的刷短视频，它生效的物理距离天生比控制回路短。]
The control loop—also known as the rational loop—suppresses impulses, enables planning, and helps with delayed gratification.
[控制回路也就是理智回路，主要作用是抑制冲动、计划行为、延迟满足。]
But suppressing impulses through the control loop isn’t easy—it takes regular training.
[因此想要通过控制回路去“抑制”平时产生的冲动是不容易的，需要经常训练。]
Getting enough sleep and exercising regularly can help keep your brain in top shape.
[充足的睡眠以及身体锻炼能让大脑维持在最佳状态。]
To sum up, the truth about focus is this: choose what’s truly important based on your values, then use planning and design to guide your dopamine system toward that important thing.
[最后总结专注的真相就是通过自己的价值观选择做更重要的事情，然后通过规划与设计让多巴胺系统在这个更重要的事情上发挥作用。]
